elements.title: Lottie Williams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the actress Lottie Williams was one of the cakewalk dancers depicted on the front cover of the sheet music for Scott Joplin's "Maple Leaf Rag" (pictured)?

elements.title: Transvestism and Transsexualism in Modern Society (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1974 conference Transvestism and Transsexualism in Modern Society in Leeds became an early platform for the emergence of terms such as "gender alignment" and "trans.people"?

elements.title: Fanny Steers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that both Thackeray and Longfellow bought paintings by Fanny Steers?

elements.title: Samoa House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Samoa House was the first fale (traditional Samoan house) built outside of Samoa?

elements.title: Logan O'Hoppe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a high schooler in 2018, Logan O'Hoppe caught a home-run ball at Yankee Stadium hit by visiting player Manny Machado and was televised throwing it back on the field?

elements.title: Lasso (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lana Del Rey, who is known as an alt-pop artist, will release her first official country album, Lasso, this year?

elements.title: Potiki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patricia Grace did not intend for her novel Potiki, about the impact of land development on an indigenous community, to be seen as political?

elements.title: 1934 German referendum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1934 German referendum, some areas recorded more votes than there were eligible voters?
